Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of a Novel Disposable Leukocyte Remover in Cardiopulmonary Bypass

Trial_Design.evidence: Conducted as a substudy within a registered clinical trial (NCT05400356)

Participants.evidence: seven patients undergoing CPB at West China Hospital, Sichuan University

Intervention.evidence: The intervention was a disposable leukocyte remover featuring an RGD peptide-coated membrane, integrated into an extracorporeal circuit.

Objective.evidence: This study assesses a novel leukocyte remover designed to reduce these effects.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the reduction in activated neutrophils over 10 minutes.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and blinding were not applicable due to the study design.

Blinding.evidence: Randomisation and blinding were not applicable due to the study design.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Neutrophil counts and those expressing activation markers CD11b, CD54, CD64, or CD181 decreased by 36–39% within the first 2.5 minutes
